thread.title: DeSean Jackson home in gang-related armed invasion: report
thread.title_full: DeSean Jackson home in gang-related armed invasion: report | New York Post

author: Zach Braziller
title: DeSean Jackson home in gang-related armed invasion: report
text:
Redskins wide receiver DeSean Jackson’s Los Angeles home was the scene of a “Scarface”-style armed home invasion this week , TMZ Sports reported, citing law enforcement sources.
Jackson was not at the home in Tarzana, Calif., but he’s left to answer for associating with a crew that fought back against the invaders — even as one person in the home was pistol-whipped and suffered minor injuries, according to the report — and an incident described by TMZ’s sources as “gang related.”
“DeSean is getting ready to be a father for the first time. He’s currently in Virginia practicing with the team,” said Jackson’s publicist, Denise White. “He had no knowledge of the incident until a phone call last evening. It’s a legal matter. We’re waiting for police to let us know more about the incident.”
Jackson has denied his involvement with gangs, though his alleged ties to gang members hung over his expulsion by the Eagles last spring .
“I would like to make it very clear that I am not and never have been part of any gang,” Jackson said at the time. “I am not a gang member, and to speculate and assume that I am involved in such activity off the field is reckless and irresponsible.”
Sources in the TMZ report said one of Jackson’s affiliates staying in the house was the intended target. The intruders had been in the house before, and had cased it for the security cameras.
